title: spack create crashes for .zip files
body:
When running `spack create` for any zip file, Spack crashes with the following error message:

```
$ spack create https://github.com/PCMSolver/pcmsolver/archive/v1.1.2.zip
==> This looks like a URL for pcmsolver version 1.1.2
==> Creating template for package pcmsolver
==> Downloading...
==> Trying to fetch from https://github.com/PCMSolver/pcmsolver/archive/v1.1.2.zip
######################################################################## 100.0%
/bin/tar: This does not look like a tar archive
/bin/tar: Skipping to next header
/bin/tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
==> Something failed on https://github.com/PCMSolver/pcmsolver/archive/v1.1.2.zip, skipping.
    (Command exited with status 2:
    '/bin/tar' '--exclude=*/*/*' '-tf' '/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/var/spack/stage/spack-stage-wLtGOe/v1.1.2.zip')
==> Error: Could not fetch any tarballs for pcmsolver
```

The problem is that it uses tar to peek inside of the file and list its contents in order to deduce the build system. I wrote a fix for this in #994. Just wanted to spread awareness until it gets merged.
